#Text=Invited or not , news outlets criticize White House decision to pick and choose their peers
#Text=Monday , February 27 , 2017
#Text=On Friday
#Text=White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer held an informal " gaggle " press briefing but made a point of excluding certain news outlets .

column3:
event[16]	new[16]	_	_
4-11	189-195	gaggle	organization|event[16]	new|new[16]	coref	15-17[87_0]
4-12	196-197

column1: #Text=The White House 's decision has drawn ire from across the field , including organizations invited to the briefing , such as Fox News and The Wall Street Journal .
#Text=Sean Spicer , from file .
#Text=Image : VOA .

#Text=The New York Times and CNN , as well as the BBC , The New York Daily News , Al Jazeera , the LA Times , BuzzFeed , The Hill , and The Daily Mail , were all barred from attending the meeting , while Reuters , NBC , ABC , CBS , Fox News , Bloomberg , and the heavily conservative news outlets Breitbart News , One America News Network , and The Washington Times were admitted .
#Text=Time , the Associated Press , and some other outlets were invited to the briefing but refused to attend in protest .
#Text=Spicer held the meeting in his office rather than the usual briefing room .
#Text=He told the press the smaller gathering was because Trump had already made a large speech earlier in the day .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=We want to make sure we answer your questions , but we do n't need to do everything on camera every day .

_	_	_	_

#Text=However , he also criticized media coverage of the Trump administration , which President Trump has cited as unfair .

#Text= We 're going to aggressively push back , " one reporter recorded him saying at the gaggle .

column1: #Text=" We 're just not going to sit back and let , you know , false narratives , false stories , inaccurate facts get out there . "

#Text=This meeting took place the day after CNN issued a report claiming the White House had asked high-level employees at the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation to rebut a story in The New York Times about the Trump administration 's alleged ties with Russia and Vladimir Putin .
#Text=" Apparently this is how they retaliate when you report facts they do n't like .

#Text= Nothing like this has ever happened at the White House in our long history of covering multiple administrations of different parties , " said New York Times executive editor Dean Baquet .

#Text=Free media access to a transparent government is obviously of crucial national interest .

_	_	_	_

#Text= While we strongly object to the White House 's apparent attempt to punish news outlets whose coverage it does not like , " said Buzzfeed editor-in-chief Ben Smith , " we wo n't let these latest antics distract us from the work of continuing to cover this administration fairly and aggressively . "

column1: #Text=BBC bureau chief Paul Denahar was more formal : " We understand there may be occasions when , due to space or circumstances , the White House restricts press events to the established pool .

#Text= Some at CNN and New York Times stood with Fox News when the Obama admin attacked us and tried to exclude us , " said Fox anchor Bret Baier via Twitter , " a White House gaggle should be open to all credentialed orgs . "

column1: #Text=" The Wall Street Journal strongly objects to the White House 's decision to bar certain media outlets from today 's gaggle , " added a representative for the newspaper .
#Text=" Had we known at the time , we would not have participated and we will not participate in such closed briefings in the future . "
#Text=The White House Correspondents ' Association took a milder view :
#Text=" We 're not happy with how things went today , " said association president Jeff Mason .
#Text=" I do n't think that people should rush to judgment to suggest that this is the start of a big crackdown on media access . "

#Text=Donald Trump has stated the mainstream media portrayed the first month of his presidency unfairly , calling some of their reports " fake news " and the press themselves the " enemy of the people " and insisting they refrain from using anonymous sources .
#Text=" I 'm against the people that make up stories and make up sources , " he told the Conservative Political Action Committee in Washington D.C.
#Text=" President Trump 's calls for an end to anonymous sources was alarming .

#Text=It is not the job of political leaders to determine how journalists should conduct their work , and sets a terrible example for the rest of the world , where sources often must remain anonymous to preserve their own lives ,  said Joel Simon of the Committee to Protect Journalists .
